eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: Narantuya is stopped and defenestrated by the reanimated mummy. While patrolling the halls, Medjehtiqedti is stunned to discover that other exhibits have begun to move as well. Pepe learns the name of the mummy—Zubayr—in the curator's office.

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Anat! You're awake?
*Gasp* My head hurts...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You hit your head when you fainted. That's probably why.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It's not just my head. I'm aching all over. Why is there a bruise on my shoulder?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: And my knee?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Eek! Get away from me!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Calm down, Anat! Calm down.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: How am I supposed to calm down when a corpse just came back to life? It touched my ears, didn't it? Do I still have my ears?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: It's just copying other people's movements. It doesn't mean any harm, to you or anyone else.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Just treat it as a piece of moving furniture!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Why do you seem so comfortable with this, Pepe?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Don't look at me like that, please!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: What did you do?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Yesterday... I placed a gem that I dug up into its chest. The Originium circuit engraved into the gem woke it up.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Yesterday?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You wouldn't loan me an important archaeological discovery like this. The Varjavandabad Museum holds respect from the Shahanshah. Not even a shahzada like me could pull rank here.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: So... I had to sneak in.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: There's a reason I didn't want to lend it to you, Pepe.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: What is it? If you're worried about co-authorship, I'm cool.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It's not that...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Investment? Sponsorship? I'll renovate your entire museum, if you want!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Why are you looking at me like that?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I don't understand... why are you so obsessed with becoming the Historian of Shar-Agade? You can still carry on your research if you agree to inherit the title of Padishah from your father.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: But once you become an historian and enter the City of Gold, you will never be allowed to leave. You know that.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: All that you learned in school, all the training you underwent to hunt ruins in the desert, all that you've seen on your journeys, all that will become useless if you're the Shahanshah's historian.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Are you simply not happy with the fact that your brother was chosen?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: My dream of becoming the court historian isn't some whim. It's the dream of everyone in my family.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: We grew up dreaming about inheriting the golden reed pen from our elders.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: They tell you that whoever holds the pen carries great responsibility, to record all that has ever happened for posterity.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You are writing the truth of your time, the most complete truth that can be known, which needs no conjecture or investigation and can never be buried by sand and earth.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That is what I've always wanted to do.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I want to tell Sargon's history! I want the glory of the Shah to shine forever by my hand, and to inspire everyone who reads it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Thousands of years later, someone I will never meet will pick up those pages and feel a connection to me and the Shah, linking the three of us.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Don't you think that's really romantic, Anat?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I should have known that you wouldn't give up so easily...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Shouldn't you and Titi have gotten used to my stubbornness by now?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Very well, on behalf of the museum, I approve the loan of the artifact... plus another gem.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: It was gifted to the museum by a private collector many years ago. We discovered that it was connected to the mummy, but we have no idea how to use it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: There's a gem at the museum too?!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That's not the point. The point is I'm allowing you to access it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You're going to hand it over so easily?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I never said anything about easy. Co-authorship, investment, sponsorship, plus naming rights fees for the new exhibition hall.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Absolutely! With pleasure!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Things don't always turn out the way we expect them to. I hope you understand this before you start your investigation.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Anat opens the drawer and takes out a wrapped package.
She unwraps it to reveal a pyramid-shaped gem, identical to the one that was placed in the mummy's chest.
Pepe takes the gem, holding back the urge to cry out in joy.
'Second, the lungs. At their first breath, we come to feel.'
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Don't let me down.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe reaches into the mummy's chest cavity. The gem is absorbed by the blue light inside as soon as it approaches.
Guardian, sealed in sand, I hereby return to you the memories lost to time.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Show the path to the Shah's trove, traveler from the past!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It stopped moving after I put in the second gem?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Did... you expect something different?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Eek—!!
That wasn't me. Who's screaming?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It was Titi's voice.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Is something happening?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'll investigate. Keep an eye on the exhibit.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Why didn't you tell me you were just an ordinary cloudbeast?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Well... I guess ordinary cloudbeasts don't understand human speech.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Looks like all the visitors have been evacuated. It's safe for us to go out now. Do you think you could find your way back to Lazvar if I put you down outside?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Hey, stop hitting me! I'm carrying you so you don't have to walk yourself!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: That's right. Awww, such nice fur... come, I'll introduce you to other little friends of yours.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Look at the imagery on this powder box. This cloudbeast is depicted in equal prominence to a high official. I restored this, by the way.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: And here. This mural is a rare treasure that came from Shar-Agade, the City of Gold.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: In order to accurately restore it, I looked through every book I could find on the Golden City, and even interviewed people who have been there.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Wait. Does that make me sound like I'm after the secrets of Shar-Agade?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Shouldn't think too much about it. You're just a cloudbeast, and there's no one else in the museum. It's not like what I just said would get me in trouble.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Suddenly, she hears the faint sound of cracking.
Don't tell me...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: No—! Why did the glass have to pick now to crack?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I'm dead if Anat finds out!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Medjehtiqedti runs toward the display stand, and is shocked by the sight of broken glass littering the floor.
Display cases use specially tempered glass. In the controlled environment of the museum, an accident like this should not have been possible.
She looks up to check on the exhibit, but finds the case empty under the pale light.
She feels a cold, sharp object pressing against her back as she attempts to examine the broken glass.
If this is some kind of joke, you can stop.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I'm too busy for this.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Playing dumb? Which department are you from?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I'm going to dock your pay, if you don't start talking...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Medjehtiqedti feels the object pressed against her back move away. She sighs of relief and turns around.
One of the interns? You've got nerve, playing practical jokes on the vice curator. I'll let you off easy this time...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Eek—!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: You... you...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: How did you get out of your case?!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Why haven't I heard anything else after that scream? Anat hasn't come back yet... well, I'll just look around.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Anat never changes, does she? She's the acting curator, yet her office still looks so bare and sparse.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: She had so many books back in the dorms. Why aren't there any here?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: She must be hiding them somewhere...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I knew it. A hidden bookshelf in the wall.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Hmm... My bookshelf at home is due for renovation... I should ask her to introduce me to the designer.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Let's see what you have here... A Study on Tribal Religion in the Southwest, Review of Unearthed Riverside Jewelry...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Terra: A Journey, by Dr. E. E. Erikson? The name sounds familiar... that's the Victorian scholar who came to speak at the college, isn't it?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Lost of labels in here. I didn't know Anat liked his books so much.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Let's check the section on Sargonian history...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (Finally, she's gone.)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (This room sure is luxurious... is that gold thread woven into the cushions on the sofa?)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (That's the mummy from the poster. They put it right here in the room? I'll never understand the tastes of rich people.)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (There she is... good, she's completely distracted...)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (With apologies...)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya walks up softly and reaches into her pocket, taking out the syringe that she has kept hidden within.
She spent countless days and nights training, even when blisters formed on her feet, in order to be able to walk across a sand dune without leaving any footprints.
Now, she can walk through a crowded market, bells hanging from her neck, without making a single sound.
A Padishah's daughter stands before her. All alone.
When Narantuya raises the syringe, however, a hand suddenly grabs hers and immobilizes it in midair.
(A hidden bodyguard?)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (You—!)
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya cannot speak.
The mummy laying on the sofa has appeared behind her, grabbing her hand with a steely grip.
Her struggles are futile, and all she can do is watch in terror as the needle approaches her own neck.
The other hand of the mummy is clasped across her mouth, not letting go until the entire contents of the syringe have been injected into Narantuya's veins.
As her consciousness gradually fades, she feels the hand lift her by the collar and hold her outside the window.
One last thought flashes through her mind as she feels her feet dangling in the air.
If only she had more competent subordinates.
An insect lurking in the dark.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: What's that sound?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Y-You're moving again?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: My mind is no longer clouded. There is clarity. I must communicate my cognition through language.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: A-Are you alive?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: My life has long passed. What you see is simply a well-preserved vessel.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: In times of prosperity, I was His Majesty Lugalszargus Shahanshah's personal guard, defending him from the fires of battle.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: In times of decline, I willingly forsook the sweet release of death for the eternal torment of time, defending His Majesty's trove from invaders, safeguarding the Shahanshah's vow, and awaiting...
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Awaiting the return of the Shahanshah.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: H-How should I call you?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: My name is Zubayidamu Yanur Ayyusuiz.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: You may call me—Zubayr.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Mother, what is that lady doing sitting by the pond, staring down at the water?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: She's dressed in Minoan clothes. The Minoans are said to be great thinkers and debaters.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: She must be thinking about deep, philosophical questions...
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Philo... what?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: But she looks so pretty, sitting there alone...
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: Hanimefendi, the museum is closed.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: I know. I'm waiting for it to reopen.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Well... I'm afraid there's currently no schedule for reopening.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: According to procedure, the curator must declare the emergency resolved, perform a risk assessment, and report to the stakeholders before a reopening date can be announced.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: I know. One of your colleagues already told me.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: As you can see, I'm waiting.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: You said you left something in the museum?
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Is it very urgent? Could you wait for our staff to look for it? We can contact you once we've found it.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: No, I can't wait.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: How about this... I can unlock the door, and we'll have someone accompany you inside.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: Thank you—
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Mother...
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Is someone jumping from that window?!
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: Aspasia looks up at the child's cry and sees a woman falling from high up.
With little time to think or look to the guard opening the door, she dashes over and holds out her arms.
